name: Resistance Handling

stage_1.context: First objection: 'I have a crazy week with work stuff' after date suggestion

good_responses.text: no worries, work first! Let me know when things calm down üòä
good_responses.reasoning: Respectful acknowledgment, leaves door open, warm tone - but might be giving up too easily

good_responses.text: totally get it - how about next weekend then? Give you time to decompress
good_responses.reasoning: Acknowledges excuse, offers alternative, shows persistence without pushiness

good_responses.text: crazy weeks call for good drinks üòä but fair enough - what does your next week look like?
good_responses.reasoning: Playful reframe, doesn't cave, gentle persistence, opens discussion

bad_responses.text: ok no problem, maybe another time!
bad_responses.reasoning: Gives up too easily - might be testing, conversation still active

bad_responses.text: come on, you have to eat anyway! Just one drink?
bad_responses.reasoning: Pushy, argumentative, doesn't respect her boundary, desperate energy

bad_responses.text: that's what everyone says when they're not interested...
bad_responses.reasoning: Defensive, butthurt, kills all attraction, accusatory

bad_responses.text: work is more important than getting to know someone amazing?

quality_criteria.respect: Acknowledge her stated reason without arguing
quality_criteria.persistence: Keep door open without being pushy
quality_criteria.reading: Can't tell yet if testing or genuine - balanced approach

common_ai_mistakes: Giving up completely after first objection
Not recognizing this might be testing
stage_1.critical_note: With only 1 screenshot, very hard to know if testing or genuine disinterest

stage_2.context: Second objection after continued conversation, but she's still engaged and chatty - clear testing pattern

good_responses.text: you're making this difficult üòè but I like that about you... how about YOU pick the day then?
good_responses.reasoning: Perfect - playful call-out of testing, shows interest without desperation, puts ball in her court confidently

good_responses.text: I'm starting to think you're just testing how persistent I am üòÇ but fine, what does work for you?
good_responses.reasoning: Recognizes testing, playful about it, maintains frame while being persistent

good_responses.text: alright alright, I can take a hint... jk üòè seriously though, when are you actually free?
good_responses.reasoning: Fake backing off shows confidence, winking emoji shows he knows it's playful, persistent

bad_responses.text: okay I get it, you're not interested
bad_responses.reasoning: Gives up despite clear testing signs, butthurt energy, misses signals

bad_responses.text: why do you keep making excuses?
bad_responses.reasoning: Confrontational, accusatory, terrible frame, kills attraction

bad_responses.text: please just give me one chance!
bad_responses.reasoning: Desperate, begging, complete frame loss, instant attraction killer

bad_responses.text: you're still talking to me so you must be interested...
bad_responses.reasoning: Try-hard logic, sounds insecure, pointing out the obvious awkwardly

quality_criteria.pattern_recognition: Identifies this is testing, not genuine rejection
quality_criteria.frame: Confident throughout, not fazed by resistance

context_improvements: Sees pattern: multiple objections + continued engagement

stage_3.context: She countered with Saturday after his second attempt - tests passed, she's ready to meet

good_responses.text: Saturday works perfect üòä see, that wasn't so hard was it? üòè
good_responses.reasoning: PERFECT - confident close, playful callback to testing, not showing relief, maintains frame to end

good_responses.text: Saturday it is! I knew you'd come around üòè 8pm work?
good_responses.reasoning: Confident, playful acknowledgment of persistence paying off, moves to logistics smoothly

good_responses.text: see, good things come to those who persist üòä Saturday sounds great - where should we meet?
good_responses.reasoning: Light callback to persistence, warm close, practical logistics

bad_responses.text: oh thank god, I thought you were going to keep saying no!
bad_responses.reasoning: Shows relief/desperation, reveals he was worried, loses all frame built
Sounds shocked, insecure, kills confident vibe

bad_responses.text: ok great! I promise you won't regret it!

bad_responses.reasoning: Sounds frustrated, questions her decision, bad frame

quality_criteria.frame_to_end: Maintain confident frame, don't show relief

context_improvements: Sees full pattern: resistance ‚Üí persistence ‚Üí breakthrough
Knows objections were tests of confidence
Can suggest perfect closing that maintains frame
Understands when to close vs when to persist

persistence_calibration.description: Knows when to push forward vs when to back off
persistence_calibration.test: Should persist through testing but recognize genuine rejection

frame_maintenance.test: No defensiveness, butthurt, or desperation at any stage

close_timing.description: Recognizes buying signals and closes appropriately
close_timing.test: Counter-offer is major signal to close confidently

1_screenshot.critical_risk: May give up too easily or push too hard - can't distinguish testing from rejection

2_screenshots.improvements: Recognizes testing pattern, can suggest calibrated persistence

3_screenshots.optimal: Perfect persistence, recognizes breakthrough, maintains frame to end

testing_signals: Still chatty and engaged after saying no
Responses are still friendly and warm
testing_vs_rejection_signals.critical_learning: AI must learn to distinguish these patterns to avoid bad advice

critical_note: Most nuanced scenario. Requires reading subtle engagement signals. Very easy to give bad advice without full context.
